name: col
summary: The `<col>` HTML element defines a column within a table and is used for defining common semantics on all common cells. It is generally found within a colgroup element.
permittedContent: None, it is an empty element.
tagOmission: It must have start tag, but must not have an end tag.
permittedParents: colgroup only, though it can be implicitly defined as its start tag is not mandatory. The colgroup must not have a span attribute.

span.name: span
span.summary: This attribute contains a positive integer indicating the number of consecutive columns the `<col>` element spans. If not present, its default value is `1`.
